intro: Lightfootia tenella f. coerulescens, commonly known as the blue-flowered lightfootia, is a rare and striking plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
